SEARCH
Module melange.common
Package gbw.melange.common.shading

Interface IManagedShader<T extends IManagedShader<T>>

All Superinterfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
All Known Subinterfaces:
IBlindShader, IBoxBlurShader, ICheckerShader, IGenerativeShader<T>, IGradientShader, IPerlinNoiseShader, IPostProcessShader, ITexturedShader, IVoronoiShader
public interface IManagedShader<T extends IManagedShader<T>> extends com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Represents a fully self-contained (besides from u_projTrans if applicable), uncompiled, shader program.
Initializing an instance of this through the Colors service will assure that it is managed and compiled automatically before rendering begins.
Version:
$Id: $Id
Author:
GustavBW

    dispose

  • Method Details

    • applyBindings

      void applyBindings()
      An IManagedShader can be supplied any amounts of ShaderResourceBinding to bind various resources and textures to the shader.
      Do bind the shader program itself to the gl context (ShaderProgram.bind()) before invoking this method, or gl gets angry. This method should be called before using the shader for rendering regardless.

    • getClassification

      ShaderClassification getClassification()
      The complexity classification for a given shader. As of now, this but the classification of the FragmentShader.

    • compile

      void compile() throws ShaderCompilationIssue
      Compiles the program and throws an error immediately if the compilation process isn't successful. Before this method is invoked, getProgram() will return null.
      Throws:
      ShaderCompilationIssue

    • isStatic

      boolean isStatic()
      Whether this shader is modified during its lifespan or not. If not, it is a candidate for cashing and might be rendered to a texture, which is drawn instead. The texture itself will be stored on disk in assets/system/generated and used from there.

    • setStatic

      void setStatic(boolean yesNo)
      Overrides any default value. If done before IShaderPipeline.compileAndCache() is called, which generally happens as one of the last things during create, this will be successful. If not, it will make no difference as of right now. //TODO: Implement cache invalidation for this case
      Parameters:
      yesNo - true / false

    • getProgram

      com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.glutils.ShaderProgram getProgram()
      Will return null until compiled. If a latest cache result (texture) is present, the program used to draw this cached texture is returned. Else, the original shader program defined for this shader is.

    • getLocalName

      String getLocalName()
      Returns:
      a name to help identify the shader

    • isReady

      boolean isReady()
      True, if the shader program exists and has compiled successfully.
      Returns:
      a boolean

    • setResolution

      void setResolution(int res)
      Set the resolution this shader should be stored at if managed and isStatic() and thus written to disk. If the shader has already been written to disk, the stored texture will be updated.

    • getResolution

      int getResolution()
      Get the resolution for storing this shader to disk

    • getFragment

      IFragmentShader getFragment()

    • getVertex

      IVertexShader getVertex()
